description_of_request: I'd like to request the above documents for related to Account 486861.

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records.    1)    The "trips" data files for each Transport Network Provider, including the name of the TNP firm (which is indicated by each file name), for each period since January 1, 2020 during which such data was submitted to the City of Chicago.  We are specifically seeking the data described here: chicago.github.io/tnp-reporting-manual/trip/. I understand that you may deem the information in Fields T1, T2 and T3 as exempt from disclosure pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(b) and will not object to omission of said data fields.    2)    The compensation data files for each TNP, including the name of the TNP firm which provided it, for each period since January 1, 2020 during which such data was submitted to the City of Chicago.  I understand that you may deem the information in Fields Comp 1 and Comp 2 as exempt from disclosure pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(b) and will not object to omission of said data fields.    This request may be fulfilled by provision to us of each file submitted during the period covered by the request following the format [company]-trip-[data].csv, with the file names visible.  However, if the City of Chicago has compiled such data for easy analysis into a single spreadsheet or set of spreadsheets which include the relevant data fields and the names of the TNPs, we request that the information instead be provided in that spreadsheet format. We have no desire for this request to be unduly burdensome and will be pleased to discuss with your staff provision of the data in a different format if it would simplify and speed response to this request.   I request that the data be provided to us electronically in a format readable in Excel.    I am making this request on behalf of PowerSwitch Action, a 501(c)(3) charitable organization.  This request is made for the purpose of accessing and publicly disseminating information regarding the welfare and the legal rights of the general public as per 5 ILCS 140/3, Section 3(c) and it will serve no commercial purpose.  We therefore request a waiver of all fees.  In the event that you believe that fees should be assessed, please inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling this request.   Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. I do understand that your response may be delayed by holiday vacations and therefore will not object if it actually takes ten business days.

I am requesting documentation related to the processing of a retail liquor license for a corporate applicant in the name of Xtra Value Food Marts, Inc., incorporated February 24, 1969 in Illinois. This entity (doing business as Rothschild Liquors/Liquor Mart) applied for a liquor license at 114 S. Cicero Avenue, with the following trajectory, as far as I can determine: 1. First submitted application (date of signature) by Nathan Newman, President of Xtra Value Mart, Inc. on Feb. 26, 1969; disapproval by Mayor’s office stamped July 21, 1969. 2. Second submission by Nathan Newman on March 28, 1969; disapproval stamped July 21, 1969. 3. Third submission by Earmon Stewart, President of Xtra Value Mart, Inc. on Apr. 4, 1969; disapproval letter mailed July 28, 1969. 4. Fourth submission by Earmon Stewart, December 3, 1969; disapproval stamp/letter dated Feb. 27, 1970. Following the fourth submission, the process continued as follows: May 1, 1970 - LAC reversed Mayor; May 21, 1970, Mayor’s Application for re-hearing denied by LAC. I believe this ultimately resulted in License # 6947 being granted on June 30, 1970. I request any and all documentation related to the license application, disapproval or other rulings by the City, the appeal made by the Applicant, and the Mayor’s application for re-hearing, with any associated documents.

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (“FOIA”), as amended (5 ILCS 140/1 et seq.), I, the undersigned, am requesting the following public records from the Chicago Department of Business Affairs and Consumer Protection:

1. A list of all private booting licenses granted in Chicago.

2. A list of all registered locations at which the aforementioned licensees engage in booting operations.

3. Any and all communications between BACP Commissioner Kenneth Meyer and lobbyist Joseph Moore and/or his firm Joe Moore Strategies from December 2021 to the present, including emails and text messages.

I will remind you that rulings in multiple court cases have found that communications pertaining to public business conducted on a private device (i.e. texts on a personal cell phone) are still subject to public records laws.

I look forward to hearing from you in writing within five working days, as required by 5 ILCS 140/3.

I care to submit an official complaint once again. I have been given several departments and contact information since the initial incidence. I'm not sure which office or department is the correct place to file my complaint. Please file, direct or forward this complaint to the proper authorities overseeing these type of matters. 
The following is: The basis of my complaint and contact information.
On July 14 approximately 1:45 am at ORD (O'Hare Airport) I was approached by an American United Cab for service. I stated to the driver that I was bound for Rivers casino down the road. This was his second attempt around to solicit my trip. I informed the person working at the ORD taxi stand, who warned him the first time when he drove off. After a short period of time and no other cabs arriving for a pickup, I accepted the only cab 3899 services.
Upon arriving at the River, I handed the driver a 100 dollar bill, whereas the driver took my money and gave me $50 worth of change back. I asked to see his meter for fares, which he had completely powered off, so I request a receipt, which he could not and did not have and did not produce. I then asked him his name, which I could not understand and may have been Farnado. I wrote down the number on his cab 3899.
I contacted the American United cab company thereafter. I was given another number to contact, which I attempted to reach that number also to file an official complaint. I left a message and couple days later, I received a returned call and initiated my first complaint. I was subsequently informed his name is Muneer, and he had several other complaints accredited to his services sanctions and infractions levied against this driver, and he was currently on suspension at that very moment, and they took my information, and said they would send me a $10 check. I now have that check as evidence to this incidence and to substantiate my claim and complaint. This negligence of this company to leave such a predator in their employment is a subject to be addressed later.
I am interested in filing a FOIA for the information surrounding this involved employee, and would appreciate all relevant and pertinent background information or in the interim being directed to the right department for caring out the FOIA request if this department does not handle such matters.
***
Seeking copies of complaints against Taxi 3899 driver Muneer.

What I am requesting for prompt disclosure are records within your possession detailing [1] your
discussions about the decision of the Speaker of the Texas House of Representatives (Dade
Phelan) to create by proclamation the Investigative Committee on the Robb Elementary
Shooting, pursuant to Rule 1, Section 17, and Rule 4, Sections 57 and 58, of the Rules of the
House of Representatives; [2] your discussions about the Investigative Committee having been
tasked to “conduct all inquiries into the actions of any State or local officer, employee,
department, agency, institution, or instrumentality and any political subdivision needed to make
a complete and thorough examination of the facts and circumstances of the events relating to the
violent acts, shootings, and murders at Robb Elementary School in Uvalde;” iii [3] your
discussions about the testimonies provided to the Investigative Committee by employees of the
Uvalde Consolidated Independent School District (CISD), the Uvalde CISD Police Department,
the Uvalde Police Department, the Uvalde County Sheriff Office, the Department of Public
Safety, the Advanced Law Enforcement Rapid Response Training (ALERRT), Uvalde Mayor
Don McLaughlin, and members of the shooter’s family between June 16th 2022 and July 11th
2022 in “executive sessions closed to the public;” iv [4] your discussions about the finding of the
Investigative Committee, which concluded that the shooting at Robb Elementary School could
happen elsewhere;v
[5] your discussions about the finding of the Investigative Committee, which
concluded that law enforcement agencies must “acknowledge that stopping the killing of
innocent lives is the highest priority in active shooter response, and all officers must be willing
to risk their lives without hesitation;” [6] your discussions about the finding of the Investigative
Committee, which concluded that law enforcement responders of the May 24th 2022 Robb
Elementary School shooting “failed to adhere to their active shooter training;”
vi [7] the training
provided to employees of your police/sheriff departments on how to effectively deal with an active shooter incident at a school/college/university operating in your city/county/state
government; [8] your discussions about the finding of the Investigative Committee, which
concluded that the mass-shooting at Robb Elementary School was motivated by a “desire for
notoriety and fame;”
vii [9] your discussions about the decision of the Investigative Committee to
dedicate their July 17th 2022 report to victims and family members of the shooting at Robb
Elementary School; viii [10] your discussions about the July 26th 2022 suspension of former Robb
Elementary School principal Mandy Gutierrez;ix [11] your discussions about the July 29th 2022
reinstatement of former Robb Elementary School principal Mandy Gutierrez (three days
following her suspension);x
[12] your discussions about the June 22nd 2022 decision of Uvalde
CISD to place former Police Chief Pete Arredondo on unpaid administrative leave; xi [13] your
discussions about the July 22nd 2022 decision of the Uvalde CISD to postpone a “meeting that
had been scheduled to consider terminating their school police chief, Pete Arredondo;” xii [14]
the employment contract offered to the police/sheriff chief working in your city/county
government; [15] the employment contract offered to members of your police/sheriff
departments (who are not police/sheriff chiefs but are nonetheless) working in your city/county
government; [16] the standard employment contract offered to employees of your
city/county/state government, who are not working as agents of law enforcement; [17] the
mechanism by which an employee of your city/county/state government can have an adverse
employment determination reviewed either by your Human Resources (H.R) Department and/or
other state/federal agencies; [18] the extent of your knowledge on whether Mandy Gutierrez
initiated contact with the Texas Workforce Commission (TWC) and/or the Equal Employment
Opportunity Commission (EEOC) following her July 26th 2022 suspension as principal of Robb
Elementary School; [19] the extent of your knowledge on whether Pete Arredondo initiated
contact with the TWC and/or the EEOC following the June 22nd 2022 decision of Uvalde CISD
to place him on unpaid administrative leave; [20] the work-sharing agreement concluded
between the TWC and the EEOC.

"Scooter Sharing" program, under Chapter 9-103 of the Chicago Municipal Code. Bird has
submitted a Written Demand for Hearing Pursuant to 9-103-060(d). In order to prepare for that
hearing, which should occur within the next 30 days, Bird needs the following categories of
documents:
1. All submissions from any applicant other than Bird.
2. Any written demands for hearing from any applicants other than Bird.
3. All documents regarding any evaluations or scoring of the applicants' submissions.
4. All documents listing or otherwise showing the names, titles, and roles of all persons with
responsibility for selecting or recommending the selection of operators for the City's
"Scooter Sharing" program or the RFP, including but not limited to documents, such as
calendar entries or meeting invitations, that demonstrate meetings, conversations, and
discussions between such persons related to the selection, scoring, or reconsideration of
the City's "Scooter Sharing" program or the RFP.
5. Any and all notes or documents (electronic and handwritten) related to the selection,
scoring, or reconsideration of any permit in connection with the City's "Scooter Sharing"
program or the RFP, including specifically, without limitation, the instructions given to
anyone with responsibility for scoring proposals, if/how to apply criteria for scoring
applications, instructions on discretionary and non-discretionary scoring, and the
individual scores for each proposal. 
6. Any other documents relating to the City's evaluation process for the City's "Scooter
Sharing" program or the RFP.
7. All recordings or notes from any meeting1
 regarding the City's "Scooter Sharing" program
or the RFP.
8. All communications regarding the City's "Scooter Sharing" program or the RFP, from
December 1, 2021 to present, including but not limited to communications with other
applicants.
9. Public records of communications made between the individuals responsible for scoring
proposals made in response to RFP, or between such individuals and Department of
Business Affairs and Consumer Protection, including but not limited to emails, letters or
correspondence, memoranda, meeting notes, telephone logs, chat logs, instant message
communications, text messages, “app-based” communications (such as Facebook
Messenger, WhatsApp, Skype, or Slack), and social media or alternative media postings,
dated from December 1, 2021 through the date of your search that mention, reference, or
discuss “Bird,” “Bird Rides, Inc.” or any of the other operators that submitted proposals in
response to RFP or their employees, representatives, or agents.
10. Public records of communications, including but not limited to emails, letters or
correspondence, memoranda, meeting notes, telephone logs, chat logs, instant message
communications, text messages, “app-based” communications (such as Facebook
Messenger, WhatsApp, Skype, or Slack), and social media or alternative media postings,
dated from December 1, 2021 through the date of your search that mention, reference, or
discuss the RFP evaluation process, its criteria, operator scoring, score evaluation or
metrics, the scoring process, the reconsideration process and/or the decision to award or
deny any permit or permit application related to RFP.
11. Any FOIA requests from any other person or entity regarding the City's "Scooter Sharing"
program or the RFP.
12. Any records produced in response to any FOIA request regarding the City's "Scooter
Sharing" program or the RFP.

Under the Illinois Freedom of Information Act, 5 ILCS 140, I am requesting an opportunity
to inspect and/or obtain copies of public records meeting the description(s) outlined below:
All Documents, Communications, Photographs and Videos1 in your possession, custody or
control concerning, referencing or relating to any of the following:
1 “Documents” and/or “documentation” refers to any documents that are in paper form and/or electronic
form (including on a computer hard drive, contained in computer/electronic back-ups, and/or e-mails). The
term “Document(s)” is used in its customary broad sense and includes all electronically and magnetically
stored information and all written, typed, printed, recorded or graphic statements, communications, or other
matter, however produced or reproduced, and whether or not now in existence or in your possession,
custody or control, including without limitation, all writings, analyses, reports, agreements, contracts,
communications (including intra-company communications), letters or other correspondence, instant
messages, emails, memoranda, records, notes, summaries, sound recordings or transcripts or personal or
telephone conversations, work papers, financial statements or reports, statistical or analytical, records,
minutes of meetings, and any other document, writing or other data compilation of whatever description,
including but not limited to any information contained in any computer although not yet printed out or the
memory unites containing such data from which information can be obtained or translated into reasonable
usable form, and all drafts and non-identical copies of the foregoing.
“Communication(s)” means any transmission of words or information between or among two or more
persons and includes, but is not limited to, spoken words, conversations, conferences, discussions, talks,
emails and documents, whether transmitted in person or by any electronic device such as a telephone, cell
phone, iPad, tablet, radio, facsimile, and computer.
“Photograph(s)” includes any type of photographic reproduction found on any medium, including, but not
limited to, any type of computer hard drive, back-up drive, back-up system, e-mail system, internet and/or
intranet system, paper and/or photographic paper, digital camera or other digital medium, memory card,
mobile telephone, removable/external hard drive/data source, DVD and/or CD.
Instructions for reproduction of photographs: If photographs are retained in a computer maintained
by any employee, representative or agent of the Agency or otherwise retained electronically or
digitally, please tender the digital photograph, copied at its highest resolution in electronic form
(for example, on a CD or DVD). Usually, a “.bmp” or bitmap format works to copy the digital
photograph at its highest resolution. Further, tender any negatives that may exist of any
photographs.
“Video” refers to any type of moving picture medium, for example (but not limited to), DVD, VHS, digital
video, streaming video, intranet/internet streaming video, film, mini-cassette recordings, electronic capture
of images, or digital images.
The words “relating to,” “related to,” or “reflect” shall be construed in their broadest sense and shall mean
relating to in any way to, referring to, mentioning, discussing, describing, reflecting, concerning,

What I am requesting for prompt disclosure are all records within your possession detailing [1]
the formal and informal ties that exist between your office, the Department of Justice (DOJ), the
Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC), the Government Accountability Office
(GAO), the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) and the Treasury Inspector General for Tax
Administration (TIGTA); [2] your communications about the decision of the GAO to note in
their 2003 report that “section 1203 of the IRS Restructuring and Reform Act of 1998 outlines
conditions for firing IRS employees;”
iv [3] your communications about the decision of the GAO
to note in their 2003 report that 3,970 (three thousand nine hundred and seventy complaints)
were filed pursuant to section 1203 against employees of the IRS between July 1998 and
September 2002; [4] your communications about the decision of the GAO to note in their 2003
report that 419 (four hundred and nineteen) complaints, which were filed pursuant to section
1203 were substantiated as violations between July 1998 and September 2002; [5] your
communications about the decision of the GAO to note in their 2003 report that 71 (seventy one)
IRS employees were fired from their jobs for violating section 1203;v
[6] your communications
about the decision of the GAO to note in their 2003 report that “IRS and TIGTA have taken steps
intended to correct known problems in their processing of section 1203 employee misconduct
cases – such as lengthy investigations and conflicts of interest during investigations;” [7] your
communications about the decision of the GAO to note in their 2003 report that “both IRS and
the TIGTA have responsibilities related to section 1203;” [8] the documents outlining the
responsibilities of the IRS and the TIGTA pursuant to section 1203; [9] the documents outlining
the actions taken by the IRS and the TIGTA to “correct known problems in the processing of
section 1203 employee misconduct cases – such as lengthy investigations and conflicts of interest
during investigations;” [10] the number of complaints filed against employees of the IRS pursuant to section 1203 between October 01st 2002 and March 01st 2022; [11] the number of
complaints, which ended up being substantiated as violations of section 1203 between October
01st 2002 and March 01st 2022; [12] the number of IRS employees, who ended up losing their
positions of employment for violating section 1203 between October 01st 2002 and March 01st
2022; [13] your communications about whether employees of the IRS have the right to contact
the EEOC or an agency official responsible for the administration of equal employment
opportunity (EEO) program when under investigation pursuant to section 1203; [14] the names,
the academic backgrounds, the professional responsibilities, and annual salaries of IRS
employees, who have opted to contact the EEOC and/or an agency official responsible for the
administration of EEO programs upon learning credible information that they are under
investigation pursuant to section 1203; [15] the documents outlining the outcome of a section
1203 investigation when an IRS employee opted to contact the EEOC and/or an agency official
responsible for the administration of EEO program within the IRS; [16] your communications
about the GAO 2003 report recommending for “IRS and TIGTA to develop (i) results-oriented
goals for processing section 1203 cases, (ii) performance measures that are balanced and can be
used to assess progress towards those goals, and (iii) methods for collecting and analyzing
performance data related to the goals and measures;” [17] your communications about the
decision of the Acting Commissioner of the Internal Revenue to agree with the recommendations
of the GAO March 2003 report; [18] your communications about the decision of the Acting
Inspector General for Tax Administration to neither agree or disagree with the GAO 2003
recommendations; [19] the academic backgrounds, the professional responsibilities and annual
salaries of James R. White, Kevin Dooley, Evan Gilman, Patty Hsieh, Shirley Jones, Stuart
Kaufman, Anne Laffoon, MacDonald Phillips, Kristen Plungas, Brenda Rabinowitz, Anne
Rhodes-Kline, Andrea Rogers, Wendy Turenne, Chris Wetzel, Bob Wenzel and Pamela J.
Gardner at the time of their employment with the GAO, the IRS and the TIGTA; [20] your
communications about the DOJ (OIG) March 2022 report advising FBI Director Christopher
Wray of their concerns in the manner the FBI “delegates the responsibility for Internal Affairs
Investigation (IAI) of FBI employees who have professional relationships or friendships with the
subject or witness of the IAI;” [21] your communications about the FBI policy, which requires
for FBI Supervisory Special Agents (SSA) to “participate in certain mandatory and elective
‘Development Experiences (DE)’ before they may be promoted to Assistant Special Agent (ASA)
in Charge;” [22] your communications about IAI as a required DE to be promoted from SSA to
ASA within the FBI; [23] your communications about Full Field Office Inspections (FOI) as a
required DE to be promoted from SSA to ASA within the FBI; [24] your communications about
the FBI “ongoing practice of (i) not assigning SSAs to FOIs of the field offices or divisions in
which they are currently employed; and (ii) requiring SSAs to attest that they have not been
employed in the division or field office that is the subject of FOI during the three years before
being assigned to FOI” to avoid potential conflicts of interest; [25] your communications about
the FBI as a federal agency, which does not observe similar practices for IAI as it does for FOI;
[26] your communications about the circumstances, which led to the OIG making public their
March 2022 report; vi [27] your communications about the decision of the OIG to note that the
“Standards of Ethical Conduct for Employees of the Executive Branch (Standards of Conduct)
located at 5 C.F.R. Part 2635 contain a section addressing impartiality and related appearance
issues;” [28] your communications about the decision of the OIG to note that Section 502 “states
than an employee should not participate in a particular matter involving specific parties without
authorization where the employee knows that the matter is ‘likely to have a direct and predictable effect on the financial interest of a member of his household or knows that a person
with whom the employee has a covered relationship’ (such as a relative or a person with whom
the employee is seeking a business, contractual, or other financial relationship) is or represents
a party to such matter and ‘where the employee determines that the circumstances would cause a
reasonable person with knowledge of the relevant facts to question his impartiality;’” [29] your
communications about the decision of the OIG to note in their March 2022 report that “an
employee who is concerned that circumstances other than those specifically described in
[Section 502] would raise a question regarding his impartiality should use the process described
in this section to determine whether he should or should not participate in a particular matter;”
[30] your communications about Michael A. Ayele (a.k.a) W, as a former employee of the
Missouri Department of Mental Health (DMH), who has on October 01st 2021 contacted his
former employers to express several concerns about conflicting interests that exist within his
previous place of employment; vii [31] your communications about the DMH as a state agency,
which has in response to Michael A. Ayele (a.k.a) W specific concerns disclosed their policies
about marriage in the Fulton State Hospital (FSH) Sexual Offender Rehabilitation and Treatment
Services (SORTS) center; [32] your communications about the DMH as a state agency, which
makes the final decision as to whether patients/prisoners in SORTS get to be married or not; [33]
your communications about the DMH as a state agency, which prohibits for patients/prisoners of
SORTS to marry one another; [34] your communications about the DMH as a state agency,
which doesn’t in clear and unequivocal terms prohibit marriage between staff and
patients/prisoners; [35] your communications about the DMH as a state agency, which has
conflicting policies on (i) marriages between staff and patients/prisoners as well as (ii) marriages
between patients/prisoners among themselves;viii [36] the policies adopted by your offices on
romantic relationships and conflict of interest at the workplace; [37] your communications about
studies, which have indicated that 30% of married couples met their spouse in academic/work
setting; ix [38] the accounting firm or other online service recommended by your office for
employees to file their tax returns; [39] the complaints filed by employees of your office against
the IRS pursuant to Section 1203; [40] the documents outlining the opportunities offered to
employees of your city/county/state/federal government to grow and earn a promotion within
your organizational unit; [41] your communications about the publicized success of the Child
Tax Credit (CTC) in reducing poverty within the borders of the U.S.A;x
[42] the impact of CTC
within the American Rescue Plan (ARP) reducing child poverty within your city/county/state
government; [43] your communications about the EEOC as a federal agency, which has
confirmed to Michael A. Ayele (a.k.a) W that they have never held any discussions about income
inequality with the IRS.xi

The purpose of this email is to seek further assistance on moving forward with case # 958880 completed 12/18/21. This morning I received a call and voicemail on  3/8/22 at 11:18am  Central Standard Time. The voicemail stated that I needed to call back or upload 2 additional rent receipts and a copy of my lease agreement that includes my name because it was cut off in the original upload. The voicemail stated to have these documents uploaded by the end of the day. I uploaded documents and called back on 3/8/22 at 12:07pm Central Standard Time. I was told my application was rejected and I needed to speak with a supervisor. 

Prior to today I have never received a call or voicemail indicating I needed any additional information. The discrepancy is because the voicemail details the information I needed to submit by the end of the day or my application is subject to rejection but when following the instructions the application was rejected anyway.

Since filling out my application 12/18/21 haven't received any alarming emails or messages in over 2months. The voicemail I received on 3/8/22 was misleading. I would like the city to look into this matter and honor the instructions detailed in voicemail. Attached to this email is the voicemail recording I received today.

This information requested can be found on the IRIS database and AHMS, 2 databases which the Department of Business Affairs and Consumer Protection uses. The information requested is: (1) the Legal Business Name (2) the DBA name (Respondent's name), (3) Business Address (street number, street name, city, state, zipcode), (4) offense (ordinance violation with section number from the Municipal Code of Chicago, (5) violation date and time, (6) date and time of administrative hearing appearance, and (7) ticket number. I am writing to you in the name of the Belgrade Dance Festival.
Thanks to this festival, Belgrade has become an important stop over in biographies of the artists who create trends in the area of artistic dance and theatre, a place where new productions are discovered and where young and renowned authors are presented with equal attention. Ongoing trends of the programme have determined the position of this event on the global map, while high standards and brave introduction of new choreographic
manuscripts and esthetics are improving expectations of the audience and are dictating challenges of content creation.

The Belgrade Dance Festival has represented works from the Hubbard Street Dance of Chicago, and has introduced to the Belgrade audience this great company. And a letter of thanks was sent from the former Mayor of Chicago, Mr. Emanuel, for this matter.

As the Belgrade Dance Festival  approaches it's jubilee, (2023), when the Festival will mark two decades of its duration, we plan to release a new monograph and prepare a documentary film.
In that matter, I am writing you a letter, in hope of your assistance and help with an enormously bad experience we had in the past two days with a tech company based in Chicago.

The Belgrade Dance Festival bought a camera through the invoice provided to us by the Personal Electronics shop in Chicago on 02/18.2022. https://personalelectronicsltd.com/
We have emails where they have confirmed that they have received the payment of 5000$. on 2/23/2022. to an account in your bank, account number: [REDACTED], account holder name Jose R Alejo, IBAN: [REDACTED], SWIFT code: [REDACTED]

We have also paid for the shipping which was part of the invoice. 
Through whatsapp they have asked for an additional 999$ for the shipment to be made, and they did not want to send this requirement through an official email. Thus, we have asked for a refund of our money, because mentioning or trying to add any additional costs in this phase, through whatsapp messages, is not acceptable. They have issued one and final invoice, according to which we performed the payment. 
Today, 02/24/2022. They have said that if we don't pay 999$ they will neither refund us the $5000 nor will they send the camera to the address of our partner organization in New York, the Joyce Theater. 
The invoice was named on Personal Electronics Limited, while the payment and bank instructions were directed to an individual : Jose Alejo,
this is a clear indication of money laundering. We are reporting to you fraudulent activity and mishandling and fooling consumers.

I am sending you attached the invoice to which we have made the payment, the SWIFT which confirms that the money has been transferred, and part from the email communication.
The Belgrade Dance Festival is a governmental organization and the US Embassy in Serbia has been informed about this case. We also informed the Serbian Embassy in Washington and the Serbian Consulate in Chicago.

What I am requesting for prompt disclosure are all records within your possession detailing (1) the formal and informal ties that exist between your office, the NCD,v the APA, vi the American Psychological Association, vii the NAMI,viii the Judge David L. Bazelon Center for Mental Health Law,ix the Department of Justice (DOJ), the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC), the Federal Communications Commission (FCC), the City of Baltimore, Maryland and the City & County of San Francisco; (2) your communications about Teresa Sheehan as a woman, who was shot multiple times by San Francisco Police officers on August 07th 2008; (3) your communications about what truly occurred on the morning of August 07th 2008; x (4) your communications about the benefits of having police officers wear body cameras for the safety of the communities they are entrusted to protect; (5) your communications about the benefits of having police officers wear body cameras for the purpose of building community trust
transparency and accountability in their daily activities; (6) your communications about the benefits of having mental/public health treatment centers install audio and video security cameras for the safety of patients/prisoners as well as staff working in the facilities; (7) the training provided by your police/sheriff departments on the reasonable use of force and in forcing warrantless entries into private residences; (8) the training provided by your police/sheriff departments on the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA);xi (9) the training
provided to your police/sheriff department on the 4th Amendment of the U.S Constitution for what constitutes unreasonable search and seizures; (10) the training provided to your police/sheriff departments on the EEOC and the laws they enforce pursuant to Title VII of the 1964 and 1991 Civil Rights Act; (11) your communications about “homelessness and unemployment correlating with illness and encounters with police;” (12) your communications
about the shift from “long-term care in state psychiatric hospital to community based treatments;” (13) the communications between the NCD, the NAMI, the APA, the American Psychological Association, the Judge David L. Bazelon Center for Mental Health Law before and after the submission of their Amicus Curiae brief to the Supreme Court on the issue of the ADA in the State of California and elsewhere; (14) your communications about the decision of the Supreme Court to grant qualified immunity to Sergeant Kimberly Reynold and Officer Kathrine Holder for their arrest of Teresa Sheehan; xii (15) your communications about the decision of the U.S House of Representative to pass the George Floyd Justice in Policing Act for the purpose of banning chokeholds and qualified immunity for law enforcement;xiii (16) your communications about the criminal charges filed against San Francisco Police Department
(SFPD) officer Kenneth Cha in the death of Sean Moore; xiv (17) your communications about Sean Moore, as a person who had been diagnosed with schizophrenia at the time of his shooting death; (18) your communications about the decision of SFPD officer Kenneth Cha to plead not guilty in the homicide charges, which were filed against him; xv (19) your communications about Freddie Gray as a Black/African American man who was born August 16th 1989 in Baltimore, Maryland; xvi (20) your communications about the arrest of Freddie Gray on April 12th 2015 for
possession of a “switchblade;” xvii (21) your communications about the decision of the Baltimore Police Department (BPD) to recognize that Freddie Gray “was not buckled in, as required by department policy” during his transportation to jail;xviii  (22) your communications about the BPD as a law enforcement agency, which has previously faced a litany of complaints for the manner in which they have transported arrestees;xix (23) your communications about the death of Freddie Gray’s being ruled a homicide by Maryland state medical examiner;xx (24) your communications about the decision of Baltimore City State Attorney Marilyn Mosby to file criminal charges against employees of the BPD involved in the arrest and death of Freddie Gray; (25) your communications about the non-conviction of BPD employees involved in the arrest of Freddie Gray; xxi (26) your communications about Freddie Gray as a Black/African American man who had a personal right to carry an assisted-opener knife without fear of arrest; xxii (27) your communications about the decision of the DOJ not to file federal criminal civil rights charges in the death of Freddie Gray; xxiii (28) your communications about the findings of the DOJ investigation into the practices of the BPD on August 10th 2016; xxiv (29) your communications about the complaint filed by Marilyn Mosby with the FCC against WBFF; (30) your communications about the response of the FCC to the complaint filed by Marilyn Mosby; xxv (31) your communications about the decision of (former Secretary of State) Hillary Clinton to criticize Fox News for their often-times misleading reports on vital issues facing the U.S;xxvi (32) your communications about the motion filed by Special Counsel John H. Durham with the U.S District Court for the District of Columbia (a.k.a) E. Barrett Prettyman Courthouse; xxvii (33) your communications about the response filed by Michael A. Sussmann’s lawyers with the U.S District Court for the District of Columbia; xxviii (34) your communications about Fox News
frequent unfair personal and professional attacks of Congresswoman Alexandria OcasioCortez;(35) your  communications about Fox News as a media organization, which has incited violence to be committed against Congresswoman Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez; (36) your communications about Fox News as a media organization, which has intentionally and maliciously denigrated the origins of Congresswoman Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez;xxix (37) your communications about Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez as a Latina Congresswoman xxx who has thus far not filed a complaint (against Fox News) for defamation and libel with the FCC and/or the judicial branch of the U.S government; (38) your communications about the dismissed defamation lawsuit filed by Sarah Palin against the New York Times;xxxi (39) your communications about the New York Times as a media organization, which recognized that it had made an “honest error” on the story they had published about Sarah Palin linking her to the deadly 2011 shooting that injured Congresswoman Gabrielle Giffords; xxxii (40) your communications about the Supreme Court finding in New York Times Company v Sullivan that “to sustain a claim of defamation or libel, the First Amendment requires that the plaintiff show that the defendant knew that a statement was false or was reckless when deciding to publish the information without investigating whether it was accurate;” xxxiii (41) your communications
about the decision of the DOJ to indict Marilyn Mosby on federal charges of perjury and making false mortgage applications; xxxiv (42) your communications about the interview of Marilyn Mosby with MSNBC journalist Joy Reid; xxxv (43) your communications about the decision of Marilyn Mosby to plead not guilty on federal perjury charges brought on by the DOJ; xxxvi (44) your communications about the cost of policing having tripled in the past 4 decades to reach $115 billion; (45) your communications about the “defund the police” movement as one that seeks to take money away from police and prisons for the purpose of prioritizing housing, employment, community health and education; xxxvii (46) your communications about the decision of several US cities to defund the police; xxxviii (47) your communications about the significant pushback faced by proponents of the defund the police movement from high-ranking members of the U.S Democratic and Republican parties; xxxix (48) your communications about the television series entitled The Good Fight deciding to show on the 5th episode of season 2, Rose Leslie and Cush Jumbo as private attorneys in police night shift ride-along;xl (49) your communications about the benefits of having attorneys (who specialize in police brutality cases) accompany law enforcement agents during their patrol of the city/county that is within their jurisdiction; (50) your communications about the provisions of the 6th Amendment of the U.S Constitution permitting attorneys (who specialize in police brutality cases) to accompany law
enforcement agents during their patrol of the city/county that is within their jurisdiction; (51) the academic backgrounds, the professional responsibilities and annual salaries of John L. I am hoping to gain access to a version of the Chicago Taxi Trips Kaggle dataset which would allow me to identify which trips were completed by a given driver. I wish to use this dataset to produce my Master's thesis for my MPhil in Economic Research at the University of Cambridge, for a project analysing the labour supply choices of taxi drivers. This is an area of substantial interest in economics, pioneered by Nobel laureate Richard Thaler with Camerer et al (1997). This project's results could be useful to the City in its capacity as a public vehicle regulatory agency, and thus carry a public benefit. This project would require that the column in the Kaggle dataset representing "taxi_id" would instead have a unique identifier for a driver, rather than a medallion. I would only need to know which trips were completed by a given driver. Thus, these data could be pseudonymized before they are released to me to mitigate any privacy concerns.

My request for records are as follows. 1) What formal and informal ties exist between your offices, the Department of Education (DoED), the Higher Learning Commission (HLC), the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), the Department of State (DoS), Westminster College (Fulton, Missouri), William Woods University (Fulton, Missouri), the Missouri Department of Mental Health (DMH), the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC) and the Department of Commerce? Have you noted Westminster College to be a historically white-male college run predominantly by white-males? Have you noted William Woods University to be a historically white-female college run predominantly by white males? Will you promptly disclose all your communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence with the DoED, the HLC, Westminster College and William Woods University either to my e-mail or in the alternative my mailing address? 2) What communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence have you had about women making up close to 60% of the student body enrolled in colleges and universities of the U.S.A as of Fiscal Year (F.Y) 2021? Do your offices hold any formal/informal opinions about women attending colleges/universities at an increased rate than previous generations? Do you believe the increased presence of women in colleges and universities of the U.S.A to be a good thing or a bad thing? Taking into consideration that 60% of those enrolled in colleges and universities are women, what communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence have you had about Westminster College student body being 56% male and
only 44% female? iii Do your offices hold any formal and/or informal opinions about the manner in which Westminster College recruits’ prospective students? What communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence have you had about Westminster College international student population constituting between 8 – 12 percent of the student body between 2009 and 2013? What communications in the form of e-mails and postal
correspondence have you had about Westminster College international student population constituting 4 percent of the student body in 2021? What communications in the form of emails and postal correspondence have you had about the sharp decrease of international students attending Westminster College in the span of 8 Fiscal Years (F.Y)? What communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence have you had about the
financial impact to Westminster College such a decrease in the number of international students constituted? Do your offices hold any formal and/or informal opinions about the need for Westminster College to be further appealing to women and international students in order to better address their financial difficulties that have made headlines? iv 3) What communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence have you had about 50% of marriages concluded in the 1980s ending in divorce? What communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence have you had about the declining divorce rate in the U.S.A? v What communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence have you had about the divorce rate in the U.S.A being significant despite a partial decline? What communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence have you had about studies that have linked happiness with marriages and children? vi Taking into consideration the nonnegligible amount of divorce as a direct consequence of marriage in the U.S.A, what communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence have you had about happiness? What I am requesting for prompt disclosure are all records within your possession detailing (1) formal and informal ties existing between your offices, the DoED, Westminster College, William Woods University, vii the DHS, the DoS, the Missouri Department of Mental Health
(DMH), the EEOC and the Department of Commerce; (2) your communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence about the Higher Learning Commission (HLC) as a non-profit organization (located in Chicago, Illinois) responsible for accrediting colleges and universities in the United States; (3) your communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence about the decision of the Higher Learning Commission (HLC) to accredit
Westminster College viii and William Woods University (located in Fulton, Missouri);ix (4) your communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence about the 2009 F-1 Visa I have obtained from the U.S Embassy in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia to pursue my undergraduate academic career at Westminster College; (5) your communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence about my having graduated in December 2016 with a Bachelor of Arts (B.A) Degree from Westminster College; (6) your communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence about my having completed the core-requirement courses for my declared majors of Economics and Political Science in May 2013; (7) your communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence about women making up close to 60% of those enrolled in colleges and universities of the U.S.A as of Fiscal Year (F.Y) 2021; (8) formal and/or informal opinions held by your offices about women attending
colleges/universities at an increased rate than previous generations; (9) your communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence about the student body of Westminster College being 56 percent male and 44 percent female taking into consideration current and future trends in the demographics of colleges/universities; (10) formal and informal opinions held by your offices about the manner in which Westminster College recruits prospective students in the U.S.A and abroad; (11) your communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence about Westminster College international student population having constituted between 8 – 12 percent of the student body between 2009 and 2013; (12) your communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence about Westminster College international student population having constituted 4 percent of the student body in 2021;x (13) your communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence about the sharp
decrease in the number of international students attending Westminster College; (14) formal and informal opinions held by your offices about the need for Westminster College to be further appealing to women and international students in order to better address their financial difficulties that have made many headlines; (15) your communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence about the appointment of Benjamin Akande as the 1st Black President of Westminster College;xi (16) your communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence about the tenure of Benjamin Akande as the 1st Black President of Westminster College;xii (17) your communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence about the appointment of Jahnae Barnett as the 1st woman President of William Woods University;xiii (18) your communications in the form of e-mails and postal
correspondence about the tenure of Jahnae Barnett as the 1st woman President of William Woods University;xiv (19) your communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence about 50% of marriages concluded in the 1980s ending in divorce; (20) your communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence about the declining divorce rate in the U.S.A; (21) your communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence about the divorce rate in the U.S.A being significant despite the partial decline; (22) your communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence about the suspiciousness of studies that have linked happiness with marriages and children; (23) your communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence about what

First, I am requesting all documents, data, and/or spreadsheets sufficient to show all unclaimed funds under the control of the Chicago Department of Business Affairs and Consumer Protecton which have NOT been reported or transferred to the Illinois State Treasurer for inclusion in the state’s Unclaimed Property fund and database.  This would include unclaimed money and property that is not yet old enough to be transferred to the Treasurer, including unclaimed refunds of any type; uncashed and/or “stale” checks or warrants; refunds or reimbursements for taxes, tuition, housing, incidentals, insurance payments, expenses, or any other type of refund or reimbursement; and all other unclaimed property and money which is currently under the control of your agency.  For all documents, data or spreadsheets that contain information on these unclaimed funds, I am requesting all fields of data, including the specific amount of each unclaimed fund; the name and the address of each person or entity to which each fund is due; a description of what each piece of unclaimed property or money is; any control number or property number attached to each property; and any applicable dates connected with each piece of unclaimed property. 

Second, I am requesting documents, data, and/or spreadsheets showing all unclaimed property which your office HAS reported and/or transferred to the Illinois State Treasurer, in response to the requirements of Illinois’ Revised Uniform Unclaimed Property Act, from January 1, 2016 to the present.  I request that these documents, data and/or spreadsheets include all available fields, including the specific amount of each parcel of unclaimed property which was reported and/or transferred to the Illinois Treasurer’s office; a description of what the property or cash is; the name and address of the person or entity due the property or cash; any date associated with each parcel of unclaimed property or cash; and any control number or other reference number for the property or cash.

Third, I am requesting documents, data and/or spreadsheets showing all claims for unclaimed property DUE TO the Chicago Department of Business Affairs and Consumer Protecton FROM the Illinois Treasurer’s Unclaimed Property fund, for which you have submitted a claim or documentation to the Illinois Treasurer’s Office, from January 1, 2016 to the present, including the amount of each property claimed; the date your office submitted the claim, the property ID number from the Illinois State Treasurer’s Unclaimed Property database, and the current status of each claim you submitted (i.e., whether you received the property or money, or whether the claim is still pending).

What communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence have you had about Alexandria Kostial request to meet Brandon Theesfeld in July 2019 to discuss her possible pregnancy? What communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence have you had about Brandon Theesfeld July 18th 2019 request for Alexandria Kostial to have an abortion? What communications in the form of emails and postal correspondence have you had about Brandon Theesfeld July 19th 2019 request for Alexandria Kostial to meet her in the evening? What communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence have you had about Brandon Theesfeld meeting with Alexandria Kostial on the evening of July 19th 2019? What communications in the form of emails and postal correspondence have you had about the conditions of Alexandria Kostial body when it was found on July 19th 2019? What communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence have you had about Brandon Theesfeld admission to shooting Alexandria Kostial with a Glock model 22.40 caliber pistol on 8 (eight) separate occasions? What communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence have you had about
the autopsy of Alexandria Kostial body confirming that she was not pregnant? What communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence have you had about the arrest of Brandon Theesfeld on July 22nd 2019? What communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence have you had about the judicial branch of the Mississippi government finding (in October 2020) Brandon Theesfeld “competent and sane as well as mentally competent to stand trial?” What communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence have you had about the legal representatives of Brandon Theesfeld concluding a plea agreement that makes him eligible to “petition for a conditional release at the age of 65 and once he has served 15 years of his sentence?” iii Taking into consideration Alexandria Kostial’s 2019 murder (or other similar cases), do your offices hold any formal and/or informal opinions about {a} the right of women to do what’s best for their bodies in the event they get pregnant, {b} the right of women to be able to carry a pregnancy to term if they wish to do so, {c} the right of women to be free from harassment and other undue influence while pregnant, and {d} the right of women to have an abortion if they wish to do so? 2) What communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence have you had about the State of Mississippi efforts to overturn the landmark 1973 Supreme Court ruling of Roe v Wade? What communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence have you had about the State of Mississippi passing restrictive legislation which outlaws’ abortion at 15 (fifteen) weeks? What communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence have you had about the State of Mississippi inspiring the State of Texas to pass further restrictive legislation which outlaws’ abortion at 6 (six) weeks? iv What communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence have you had about the strong likelihood that most women are unaware of their pregnancy 6 weeks in? What communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence have you had about the unduly harsh Texas law prohibiting people to provide assistance to women wishing to get an abortion? What communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence have you had about the unduly harsh Texas law permitting private citizens to bring civil suits against anyone who assists a pregnant woman seeking an abortion in violation of the ban? v What communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence have you had about the unduly harsh Texas law prohibiting abortion even in circumstances of rape and incest? What communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence have you had about the unduly harsh Texas law being hypocritical taking into consideration that prisons/jails/asylums of the State of Texas prohibit for their prisoners/patients to read books with content depicting rape and incest? What communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence have you had about the hypocrisy of Texas prisons/jails/asylums prohibiting books such as
The Color Purple, Freakonomics and Monty Python’s Big Red Book taking into consideration the unduly harsh recently passed Texas law? What communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence have you had about the message sent by the Texas criminal justice system in permitting for patients/prisoners in their asylums/jails/prisons to read Adolf Hitler’s Mein Kampf while at the same time prohibiting them to read The Color Purple, Freakonomics and Monty Python’s Big Red Book? vi Will you promptly disclose the place, the date and time you have last read Mein Kampf, The Color Purple, Freakonomics and Monty Python’s Big Red Book? Do your asylums, jails and prisons have a policy about the type of books their prisoners/patients can read while confined to a locked environment? Taking into consideration the hypocrisy of Texas recently passed legislation, what
communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence have you had about the consistency of former President Donald Trump to {a} revere Adolf Hitler in private and {b} praise Robert E. Lee in public? vii What communications in the form of e-mails and postal correspondence have you had about the City of Portland, Oregon symbolic decision to cut financial and economic ties with the State of Texas for passing further restrictive legislation in terms of abortion than the State of Mississippi? viii What communications in the form of emails and postal correspondence have you had about the real possibility of pregnant women in the State of Texas (among other places similarly situated) leaving their home-state to go to the State of California and/or the State of Oregon (among other places similarly situated) to get an abortion? ii.    Total trips by WAV vehicles/drivers

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act, 5 ILCS 140 et seq., I write to request access to, or copies of, the following public records in the possession or control of the Chicago Department of Business Affairs and Consumer Protection (“BACP”)—including but not limited to any of its members, staff, and/or former staff—relating to actions BACP has taken against third-party delivery platforms.1
I request the following Documents2:
1. All Documents evidencing financial support or investment received by BACP in connection with investigations by BACP regarding any third-party delivery platforms, during the period January 1, 2020 to the present.
2. All Documents evidencing agreements between BACP and the City of Chicago Department of Law, including but not limited to agreements regarding legal representation, relating to the City of Chicago Department of Law’s representation of BACP in enforcing the Municipal Code of Chicago against third-party delivery platforms.
3. All Documents evidencing agreements and/or financial arrangements between BACP and any consultant, including but not limited to Berlin Rosen, Joanna Klonsky and/or Joanna Klonsky Communication Strategies, Zack Koutsky and/or Berteau Consulting, Economic Security Project, or Nation Consulting, relating to third-party delivery
platforms, during the period January 1, 2020 to the present.
4. All Documents evidencing correspondence or communications between any member or staff of BACP, on the one hand, and any consultant, including but not limited to Berlin Rosen, Joanna Klonsky and/or Joanna Klonsky Communication Strategies, Zack Koutsky and/or Berteau Consulting, Economic Security Project, or Nation
Consulting, on the other hand, relating to third-party delivery platforms, during the period January 1, 2020 to the present.
5. All Documents evidencing correspondence or communications between any member or staff of BACP and any labor organization, coalition, or group, including but not limited to Illinois AFL-CIO and the Future of Work Illinois Coalition, regarding thirdparty delivery platforms, during the period January 1, 2020 to the present.
6. All Documents evidencing correspondence or communications between any member or staff of BACP and any trade association or organization, including but not limited to the Illinois Restaurant Association, regarding third-party delivery platforms, during the period January 1, 2020 to the present.

1 As used in this letter, “third-party delivery platforms” are Internet-based platforms that restaurants use to
arrange deliveries to consumers. These platforms include, but are not limited to, DoorDash, Grubhub,
Postmates, Uber Eats, Caviar, and Seamless.
2 As used in this letter, “Documents” include but are not limited to text messages, emails, voicemail recordings,
memoranda, and letters, located on any work or personal device, server, shared drive, or “cloud” accessible
by any person to whom this request is directed.

I hereby request access to the physical documents that the BACP is required by law to maintain, that the Illinois Attorney General Public Access counselor has addressed and that I requested in my original FOIA request of BACP dated 3/8/2021 (see below). Please consider this a NEW FOIA and start the clock today.
 
For your convenience, my FOIA Request of 3/8/2021:
FOIA Request :
There is no FOIA obligation to create documents or answer questions in this FOIA request, but public body must provide this information according to the Illinois FOIA law:
(i.e. if BACP doesn't have the requested documents, in this case, BACP must prepare the requested documents. )
– Brief description of the public body, block diagram, total operating budget,
number and location of offices, approx. number of full and part time employees,
membership of boards/councils/etc. (or website link)
– Methods by which public can request documents
– Identification of FOIA officer
– A reasonably current and detailed list of all types or categories of documents
under the public body’s control
– Copies of all notices of denial, indexed according to the type of exemption
asserted and, to the extent feasible, according to the types of records available
 
I am requesting all the above that BACP FOIA is obligated by law to provide
.
Background : Illinois FOIA law Sections 4, 5 and 9(b):
"    Sec. 4. Each public body shall prominently display at each of its administrative or regional offices, make available for inspection and copying, and send through the mail if requested, each of the following:
(a) A brief description of itself, which will include, but not be limited to, a short summary of its purpose, a block diagram giving its functional subdivisions, the total amount of its operating budget, the number and location of all of its separate offices, the approximate number of full and part-time employees, and the identification and membership of any board, commission, committee, or council which operates in an advisory capacity relative to the operation of the public body, or which exercises control over its policies or procedures, or to which the public body is required to report and be answerable for its operations; and..."
 
"   Sec. 5.    As to public records prepared or received after the effective date of this Act, each public body shall maintain and make available for inspection and copying a reasonably current list of all types or categories of records under its control. The list shall be reasonably detailed in order to aid persons in obtaining access to public records pursuant to this Act...."
 
"   Sec. 9. ... (b) When a request for public records is denied on the grounds that the records are exempt under Section 7 of this Act, the notice of denial shall specify the exemption claimed to authorize the denial and the specific reasons for the denial, including a detailed factual basis and a citation to supporting legal authority. Copies of all notices of denial shall be retained by each public body in a single central office file that is open to the public and indexed according to the type of exemption asserted and, to the extent feasible, according to the types of records requested."
